oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effects of complexing agents on phase behavior of ionic surfactant solutions
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: NARAYANAN, J
MANOHAR, C
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Krafft temperature
Cloud point temperature
Critical micelle concentration
Binding counterion
Ionic-nonionic mixed micelle
SODIUM MYRISTATE
CLOUD-POINT
MICELLAR
MIXTURES
SYSTEMS
MODEL
SALT
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A model for the complexation of an ionic surfactant with an oppositely charged non-surface active binding counterion is developed. This model is used to explain the variations in the critical micelle concentration and the Krafft and cloud point temperatures as a function of the concentration of the complexing agent.
